title: "Very Confident" About Winning Back The White House, Says Trump
content: Donald Trump feels "very confident" about winning back the White House, the Republican said Tuesday after casting his Election Day ballot in Florida in one of the most contentious US elections in decades.
summary: Donald Trump feels "very confident" about winning back the White House, the Republican said Tuesday after casting his Election Day ballot in Florida in one of the most contentious US elections in decades.

title: How The Cold Sore Virus Can Reach And Infect Your Brain
content: The virus affects critical brain regions tied to sleep, mood, and hormonal control, potentially linking HSV-1 to neurodegenerative diseases.
summary: The virus affects critical brain regions tied to sleep, mood, and hormonal control, potentially linking HSV-1 to neurodegenerative diseases.

title: Google Cleared In Lawsuit Alleging Profit From 'Gift Card Scams'
content: A federal judge dismissed a proposed class action lawsuit accusing Google of illegally profiting from Google Play gift card scams by refusing to refund millions of dollars stolen from victims.
summary: A federal judge dismissed a proposed class action lawsuit accusing Google of illegally profiting from Google Play gift card scams by refusing to refund millions of dollars stolen from victims.

title: "60% Indian Americans Expected To Vote For Harris": Ex Indian Envoy To US

title: Harris Reminds Pennsylvania Of Trump Ally's Joke About Puerto Rico
content: Tony Hinchcliffe's joke at the Madison Square Garden rally cost Trump the endorsement of popular Puerto Rican artist Nicky Jam and earned Harris the support of superstar Bad Bunny, also from Puerto Rico.
summary: Tony Hinchcliffe's joke at the Madison Square Garden rally cost Trump the endorsement of popular Puerto Rican artist Nicky Jam and earned Harris the support of superstar Bad Bunny, also from Puerto Rico.

title: Before Election Day, Harris Brings In Celebrities. Trump Is Unimpressed

title: Wives React In Shock As 50 Men Stand In Trial For Mass Rape Case In France
content: The wives and girlfriends of dozens of men on trial in France accused of raping another woman while she was drugged by her husband have reacted with anger and disbelief, although some say they will stand by the accused.
summary: The wives and girlfriends of dozens of men on trial in France accused of raping another woman while she was drugged by her husband have reacted with anger and disbelief, although some say they will stand by the accused.

title: Tim Cook And Mark Cuban Rely On These AI Tools To Save Time
content: Tim Cook receives over 800 emails while Mark Cuban gets more than a thousand emails a lot of which are repetitive'.

title: Anti-Trust Body Recalls Probe Into Flipkart's Competition Law Breach: Report
content: India's antitrust body has recalled its investigation report into competition law breaches by e-commerce giant Walmart's Flipkart, a document shows, the second such move after a report on Apple was revoked in August.
summary: India's antitrust body has recalled its investigation report into competition law breaches by e-commerce giant Walmart's Flipkart, a document shows, the second such move after a report on Apple was revoked in August.

title: Children's Reading Habit Hits Record Low, Survey Reveals Alarming Decline
content: The 2024 survey, which included over 76,000 responses, shows that only 34.6% of children aged 8 to 18 enjoy reading in their free time.
summary: The 2024 survey, which included over 76,000 responses, shows that only 34.6% of children aged 8 to 18 enjoy reading in their free time.

title: Stabbing Attack At Melbourne Shopping Centre, In Australia, Leaves 3 Injured
content: A man has been arrested after he allegedly stabbed multiple people at a shopping centre in Melbourne on Tuesday.

title: As Voting Begins, What Harris And Trump Need To Win The Presidency

title: Trump Or Harris? Who Will Inherit Biden's Mixed Legacy On Key Issues
content: Americans head to the polls on Tuesday in a mood of discontent and division, with opinion polls showing nearly two-thirds of voters believe the country has been heading in the wrong direction under President Joe Biden.

title: Last Set Of Disengagement Between India, China Ended Oct 21: S Jaishankar
content: India and China concluded the last lot of disengagement on October 21 and the implementation process is going on, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Tuesday.

title: Russia Launches 55 Satellites, Including 2 Iranian Devices Into Orbit
content: Russia launched 55 satellites into orbit on Tuesday, including two privately built Iranian devices, amid deepening ties between Moscow and Tehran.

title: UK Introduces Law To Create First "Smoke-Free Generation"
content: A new UK-wide law aimed at creating the first "smoke-free generation" will on Tuesday be introduced in parliament, as part of a world-leading ban.

title: Harris Or Trump: US Votes In Extraordinary Presidential Election
content: Voting for the 2024 US Presidential election has begun in the eastern time zone in America. New Hampshire is the first state where the polling started at 6 am local time (4:30 pm IST).
